contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox German location |name = Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg |name_local = |image_photo = |image_caption = |of_city_coa = Coat_of_arms_of_Berlin.svg |type = Borough |article_ = of |City = Berlin |Town = |image_coa = Coat of arms of borough Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg.svg |lat_deg = 52 | lat_min = 30 | lat_sec = |lon_deg = 13 | lon_min = 27 | lon_sec = |state = Berlin |district = |borough = |divisions = 2 localities |_office = |Bürgermeistertitel = |mayor = Franz Schulz |party = [[Alliance '90/The Greens]] |elevation = |area = 20.16 |population = 278579 |population_as_of = 2012-11-30 |density = |pop_ref = |postal_code = |area_code = |licence = B |free_2 = |free_2_txt = |year = |plantext = Location of Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg in Berlin |image_plan = Berlin Bezirk Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg (labeled).svg |website = [http://www.friedrichshain-kreuzberg.de official homepage] }} '''Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg''' is the second [[Boroughs of Berlin|borough]] of [[Berlin]], formed in 2001 by merging the former [[East Berlin]] borough of [[Friedrichshain]] and the former [[West Berlin]] borough of [[Kreuzberg]]. The historic [[Oberbaum Bridge]], formerly a [[Berlin border crossings|Berlin border crossing]] for pedestrians, links both districts across the river [[Spree]] as the new borough's [[landmark]] (as featured in the coat of arms). ==Overview== [[File:Berlin Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg.svg|thumb|left|Subdivisions of Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg]] The [[counterculture]] tradition especially of Kreuzberg led to a [[Plurality (voting)|plurality]] of votes for the Green Party, which is unique among all Berlin boroughs. The local [[Member of parliament|MP]] [[Hans-Christian Ströbele]] is the only Green [[politician]] directly elected to the federal [[Bundestag]]. While Kreuzberg is characterised by a high number of immigrants, the share of non-German citizens in Friedrichshain is much lower and the average age is higher. The merger between the distinct quarters is celebrated by an annual anarchic "vegetable fight" on the Oberbaumbrücke. Both parts have to deal with the consequences of [[gentrification]]. ==Subdivision== Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg is divided into 2 localities: *[[Friedrichshain]]; *[[Kreuzberg]]. ==Politics== [[Image:Allocation of seats in the borough council of Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg (DE-2011-10-27).svg|thumb|left]] At the 2011 elections for the parliament of the borough (''Bezirksverordnetenversammlung'') the following parties were elected: *[[Alliance '90/The Greens]] 22 *[[Social Democratic Party of Germany|SPD]] 13 *[[The Left (Germany)|The Left]] 7 *[[Pirate Party Germany|Pirate Party]] 5 *[[Christian Democratic Union (Germany)|CDU]] 4 ==Twin towns== *{{flagicon|Germany}} [[Wiesbaden]], Germany since 1964 *{{flagicon|Germany}} [[Porta Westfalica]] since 1968 *{{flagicon|Germany}} [[Bergstraße (district)|Bergstraße district]], since 1969 *{{flagicon|Germany}} [[Ingelheim am Rhein]] since 1971 *{{flagicon|Germany}} [[Limburg-Weilburg]] district, since 1980 *{{flagicon|Nicaragua}} [[San Rafael del Sur]], [[Nicaragua]] since 1986 *{{flagicon|Israel}} [[Kiryat Yam]], [[Israel]] since 1990 *{{flagicon|Poland}} [[Szczecin]], [[Poland]] since 1996 *{{flagicon|Turkey}} [[Kadıköy]], [[Istanbul]], [[Turkey]] since 1996 *{{flagicon|Bulgaria}} [[Oborishte, Sofia|Oborishte]], [[Sofia]] since 1999 ==See also== {{Portal|Berlin}} *[[Berlin Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg - Prenzlauer Berg East (electoral constituency)]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{commons|Bezirk Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg|Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg}} *[http://www.friedrichshain-kreuzberg.de/ Official homepage {{de icon}}] *[http://www.berlin.de/english/ Official homepage of Berlin] *[http://www.xhain.info/ Xhain.info - Private portal {{de icon}}] {{Boroughs of Berlin}} [[Category:Friedrichshain-Kreuzberg| ]]<!--CATMAIN FOR FRIEDRICHSHAIN-KREUZBERG DISTRICT--> [[Category:Districts of Berlin]]
